intro: Ipomoea fiebrigii, commonly known as the fever vine, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its climbing habit and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in tropical regions. Ipomoea fiebrigii is also known for its rapid growth and ability to scramble over other plants.
